key_points: Alec Baldwin considered 'partly responsible' for 'Rust' shooting by Halyna Hutchins' father, Anatoly Androsovych.
Halyna Hutchins died on the 'Rust' set in Santa Fe, New Mexico, in October, from a prop gun fired by Baldwin.
Baldwin deleted his Twitter account following his ABC interview discussing the incident.
Androsovych questions why Baldwin fired the shot during preparations.
Baldwin insisted he did not pull the trigger of the firearm, saying it went off as he cocked it.
Halyna Hutchins' 9-year-old son Andros is 'slowly getting back to life' after the incident.
Androsovych struggles to understand how Baldwin cannot be held partly responsible.
Baldwin stated he was following Hutchins' direction on how to handle the gun during the scene.
Baldwin claims the gun discharged when he released the hammer, not by pulling the trigger.
New Mexico police have filed a search warrant for Baldwin's phone as part of the ongoing investigation.
spokespersons: Anatoly Androsovych (Father of the deceased, Halyna Hutchins)
